title: 94-year-old woman celebrates 44 years working at McDonald’s – and she’s still lovin’ it
text:
Loraine Maurer, 94, is celebrating 44 years of service with McDonald’s (Picture: AP) This McDonald’s worker is not your average fast food employee. 
Parent slammed for sending child to school with cold McDonald’s Happy Meal as packed lunch She’s a 94-year-old great-grandmother who has spent more than four decades of her life dedicated to McDonald’s restaurants.
And Loraine Maurer, from,Evansville, Indiana is not planning to give up anytime soon – despite celebrating more that four decades of service.
The nonagenarian, who works two shifts per week, first joined in 1973 after her husband retired due to disability.

At a special party thrown by her colleagues, Mrs Maurer told ABC News: ‘I told him we were too young to stay at home and so I went for a job.’
She never thought she’d become a manager though and do such a long stint at the fast-food chain.
Mrs Maurer says she doesn’t think she’ll ever be able to quit because she loves it too much (Picture: AP) One customer who attended the party said: ‘She is the only one here that knows how to make oats right.’
After her husband passed away in 1980, she began to travel more often with a friend, and would visit McDonald’s wherever she went.
MORE: McDonald’s worker leaps through drive-thru window to save customer’s life 
Customers say she makes the perfect oats (Picture: AP) She said: ‘I’ve been to Australia, Russia, Greece, Rome, and I’d always look when I could fly over the cities. I’d look for the arch.’
McDonald’s tweets Donald Trump telling him he has tiny hands Even though she thinks about retiring every winter, she says she just can’t seem to leave.
Mrs Maurer, who has four children, six grandchildren and seven great-grandchildren, said: ‘I would miss it too much. I really and truly enjoy it.
‘Life is what you make it. And so I’m trying.’
